definition[0]: to try to stop thinking about a problem, argument, or disagreement, because you want to achieve something
example[0]: You must put aside your pride and apologise to him.
definition[1]: to save money regularly, usually for a particular purpose
example[1]: She put at least £30 a week aside for food.
definition[2]: to put down something you are reading or working with, in order to start doing something else
example[2]: He glanced at the note, put it aside and went on with the meeting.
definition[3]: to keep a period of time free in order to be able to do something
example[3]: If you’re planning a trip to the museum, be sure to put aside at least an hour and a half.
example[4]: Like many people, you may be putting money aside in one of the deposit-based savings accounts now available.
